definition: cheering excitedly (idiom)/jubilant
joyous/happy/pleased
to call/to cry/to shout/to breath out/to exhale
a freckle/lentigo
small bird/sparrow/also pr. [qiao3]
to jump/to leap

sentences.english: Nu Wa side cheering them for a while, slowly got separated.
sentences.chinese: 他們在女媧身旁歡呼雀躍了一陣，慢慢走散了。

sentences.english: They ooh and aah when the thousands of little lights in the ball come on.
sentences.chinese: 當球上的數千盞小燈亮起時，人羣一陣歡呼雀躍。

sentences.english: They cheered when the result was announced.
sentences.chinese: 投票結果公佈後，她們歡呼雀躍。

sentences.english: The team whooped it up after winning the game.
sentences.chinese: 該隊在比賽獲勝後歡呼雀躍。

sentences.english: They cheered and cheered. The hall seemed boiling.
sentences.chinese: 他們歡呼雀躍，大廳裏像開鍋了似的。

sentences.english: We exulted in the school team's victory.
sentences.chinese: 我們爲校隊的勝利歡呼雀躍。

sentences.english: He jumps up with joy for those mediaeval castles on the mountaintop.
sentences.chinese: 他爲山頂上那些中世紀的城堡而歡呼雀躍。

sentences.english: Wan Min jubilation, cheered, China's north and south corners of the country spring tide surging.
sentences.chinese: 萬民歡騰，歡呼雀躍，中國南北，五湖四海春潮湧動。

sentences.english: The people, rising in their seats and waving hats and handkerchiefs, cheered and cheered.
sentences.chinese: 觀衆都站了起來，歡呼雀躍，揮舞着帽子和手帕。
很多歐洲人忍不住要歡呼雀躍。

sentences.english: The birth of a baby is usually an occasion for joy.
sentences.chinese: 人們因孩子的出生而歡歡喜喜歡呼雀躍。

sentences.english: While foreign unions cheer, multinational companies fret.
sentences.chinese: 儘管外國工會歡呼雀躍，但是跨國公司卻愁眉不展。
整個核工業界爲這次“核文藝復興”歡呼雀躍。

definition: smile spread across the face (idiom); beaming with pleasure/all smiles/joy written across one's face
to revisit old haunts (idiom); down memory lane
lit. as if sitting on pins and needles (idiom)/fig. to be in an uncomfortable situation
When you enter a country, follow the local customs (idiom); do as the natives do/When in Rome, do as the Romans do
to engage in prostitution
vocal accompaniment in some traditional Chinese operas/to speak in support of/to chime in
to turn tears into laughter (idiom); to turn grief into happiness
(to act) on one's own initiative
Dacun township in Changhua county 彰化縣|彰化县[Zhang1 hua4 xian4], Taiwan
to shiver
to run this way and that (idiom); to rush about busily/to bustle about
seize every minute and second (idiom); not a minute to lose/every moment counts
variant of 矇騙|蒙骗[meng1 pian4]
"The Ugly Duckling" by Hans Christian Andersen 安徒生[An1 tu2 sheng1]
ugly duckling
grinning from ear to ear (idiom)/beaming with happiness
lit. cannot rest or eat in peace (idiom)/fig. extremely worried and troubled
